meanings.definition: Burn the skin or flesh of (a wound) with a heated instrument or caustic substance to stop bleeding or prevent infection.
meanings.sent1: The doctor had to cauterize the wound to stop the bleeding.
meanings.sent2: In the past, they would cauterize wounds to prevent infections.
meanings.sent3: After the battle, the soldier joked that he could cauterize his wounds like a dragon.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to cauterize his heart, leaving him speechless.
meanings.sent5: The image of the hot iron used to cauterize the wound was vivid in her mind.

meanings.definition: Burn (tissue) with a heated instrument or caustic substance to destroy it.
meanings.sent1: The surgeon needed to cauterize the tumor to remove it completely.
meanings.sent2: They had to cauterize the infected tissue to prevent it from spreading.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that he would cauterize the overcooked steak to make it edible.
meanings.sent4: The harsh truth seemed to cauterize her hopes, leaving her despondent.
meanings.sent5: The smell of burning flesh as they cauterized the tissue was unforgettable.
